class.name: model
class.description: A model component: can be executed standalone, and has as scientific description available via a link to a science.domain document. (A configured model can be understood in terms of a simulation, a model, and a configuration.).

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Long name for component.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Textural description of component.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name of component.

attribute.name: development_history
attribute.description: History of the development of this component.

attribute.name: release_date
attribute.description: The date of publication of the component code (as opposed to the date of publication of the metadata document, or the date of deployment of the model).

attribute.name: documentation
attribute.description: Descriptions of the component functionality.

attribute.name: repository
attribute.description: Location of code for this component.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version identifier.

attribute.name: internal_software_components
attribute.description: Software modules which together provide the functionality for this model.

attribute.name: simulates
attribute.description: The scientific domains which this model simulates.

attribute.name: coupled_components
attribute.description: Software components which are linked together using a coupler to deliver this model.

attribute.name: coupler
attribute.description: Overarching coupling framework for model.

choice.description: Customised coupler developed for this model
It is not known what/if-a coupler is used

attribute.name: model_default_properties
attribute.description: Model default key properties (may be over-ridden in domain properties).

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Vocabulary identifier, where this model description was constructed via a controlled vocabulary.

attribute.name: category
attribute.description: Generic type for this model.

choice.description: Global Climate Model (Atmosphere, Ocean, no carbon cycle)

class.name: sub_process
class.description: Provides structure for description of part of process simulated within a particular area (or domain/realm/component) of a model. Typically this will be a part of process which shares common properties. It will normally be sub classed within a specific implementation so that constraints can be used to ensure that the process details requested are consistent with projects requirements for information.

attribute.name: context
attribute.description: Scientific context for which this description is provided.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of this process/algorithm/sub-process/detail.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Identifier for this collection of properties.

attribute.name: implementation_overview
attribute.description: General overview description of the implementation of this part of the process.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: Sets of properties for this process.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Any relevant references describing this part of the process and/or it's implementation.

class.name: resolution
class.description: Describes the computational spatial resolution of a component or process. Not intended to replace or replicate the output grid description. When it appears as part of a process description, provide only properties that differ from parent domain. Note that this is supposed to capture gross features of the grid, we expect many grids will have different variable layouts, those should be described in the grid description, and the exact resolution is not required. Note that many properties are not appropriate for adaptive grids.

attribute.name: typical_x_degrees
attribute.description: Horizontal X resolution in degrees of grid cells, if applicable eg. 3.75.

attribute.name: is_adaptive_grid
attribute.description: Default is False. Set true if grid resolution changes during execution.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: This is a string usually used by the modelling group to describe the resolution of this grid, e.g. N512L180 or T512L70 etc.

attribute.name: number_of_levels
attribute.description: Number of vertical levels resolved.

attribute.name: equivalent_resolution_km
attribute.description: Resolution in km of 'typical grid cell' (at the equator, for gross comparisons of resolution), eg. 50.

attribute.name: number_of_xy_gridpoints
attribute.description: Total number of horizontal points on computational grids.

attribute.name: typical_y_degrees
attribute.description: Horizontal Y resolution in degrees of grid cells, if applicable eg. 2.5.

class.name: domain_properties
class.description: Properties of the domain which needs to be simulated, extend and/or resolution.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: additional_requirements
attribute.description: Additional detail for this requirement.

attribute.name: conformance_is_requested
attribute.description: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

attribute.name: required_extent
attribute.description: Constraint on extent of domain to be simulated.

attribute.name: required_resolution
attribute.description: Constraint on resolution required in simulated domain.

class.name: scientific_domain
class.description: Scientific area of a numerical model - usually a sub-model or component. Can also be known as a realm.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Any relevant references describing the implementation of this domain in a relevant model.

attribute.name: overview
attribute.description: Free text overview description of key properties of domain.

attribute.name: differing_key_properties
attribute.description: Key properties for the domain which differ from model defaults (grid, timestep etc).

attribute.name: realm
attribute.description: Canonical name for the domain of this scientific area.

attribute.name: simulates
attribute.description: Processes simulated within the domain.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Vocabulary identifier, where this domain description was constructed via a controlled vocabulary.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the scientific domain (e.g. ocean).

class.name: forcing_constraint
class.description: Identifies a model forcing constraint.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: additional_requirements
attribute.description: Additional detail for this requirement.

attribute.name: conformance_is_requested
attribute.description: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

attribute.name: origin
attribute.description: Pointer to origin, e.g. CMIP6 RCP database.

attribute.name: forcing_type
attribute.description: Type of integration.

choice.description: Best estimates of actual state (included synthesized)
Intended to represent a possible future, e.g. RCP4.5

attribute.name: group
attribute.description: Sub-Category (e.g. GHG).

attribute.name: category
attribute.description: Category to which this belongs (from a CV, e.g. GASES).

attribute.name: code
attribute.description: Programme wide code from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. N2O).

attribute.name: data_link
attribute.description: Link to actual data record if possible.

attribute.name: additional_constraint
attribute.description: Additional information, e.g. hold constant from 2100-01-01.

class.name: conservation_properties
class.description: Describes how prognostic variables are conserved.

attribute.name: corrected_conserved_prognostic_variables
attribute.description: Set of variables which are conserved by *more* than the numerical scheme alone.

attribute.name: flux_correction_was_used
attribute.description: Flag to indicate if correction involved flux correction.

attribute.name: correction_methodology
attribute.description: Description of method by which correction was achieved.

class.name: number_array
class.description: Provides a class for entering an array of numbers.

attribute.name: values
attribute.description: A space separated list of numbers.

class.name: external_document
class.description: A real world document, could be a book, a journal article, a manual, a web page ... it might or might not be online, although preferably it would be. We expect a typical citation to be built up as in the following 'authorship, date: title, publication_detail (doi if present)'.

attribute.name: publication_detail
attribute.description: Journal/publisher, page and volume information as appropriate.

attribute.name: online_at
attribute.description: Location of electronic version.

attribute.name: doi
attribute.description: Digital Object Identifier, if it exists.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: A name for the citation: short hand description, e.g. Meehl et al (2014).

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: Title or name of the document.

attribute.name: date
attribute.description: Date of publication, or of access in the case of a URL.

attribute.name: authorship
attribute.description: List of authors expressed using an appropriate syntax.

class.name: irregular_dateset
class.description: A set of irregularly spaced times.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: Number of times in set.

attribute.name: date_set
attribute.description: Set of dates, comma separated yyyy-mm-dd.

class.name: grid
class.description: This describes the numerical grid used for the calculations. It is not necessarily the grid upon which the data is output. It is NOT the resolution, which is a property of a specific domain.

attribute.name: horizontal_grid_layout
attribute.description: Type of horizontal grid-layout (e.g. Arakawa C-Grid.

attribute.name: vertical_grid_layout
attribute.description: Type of vertical grid-layout (e.g. Charney-Phillips.

attribute.name: horizontal_grid_type
attribute.description: Description of basic horizontal grid (e.g. 'cubed-sphere').

attribute.name: grid_extent
attribute.description: Key geographic characteristics of the grid use to simulate a specific domain.

attribute.name: vertical_grid_type
attribute.description: Description of basic vertical grid (e.g. 'atmosphere_hybrid_height_coordinate').

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: This is a string usually used by the modelling group to describe the grid.(e.g. the ENDGAME/New Dynamics dynamical cores have their own grids describing variable layouts.

attribute.name: additional_details
attribute.description: Additional grid properties.

class.name: party
class.description: Implements minimal material for an ISO19115-1 (2014) compliant party. For our purposes this is a much better animal than the previous responsibleParty which munged roles together with people. Note we have collapsed CI_Contact, CI_Individual and CI_Organisation as well as the abstract CI_Party.

attribute.name: orcid_id
attribute.description: Orcid ID if available.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of person or organisation.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: Institutional address.

attribute.name: email
attribute.description: Email address.

attribute.name: organisation
attribute.description: True if an organisation not a person.

attribute.name: url
attribute.description: URL of person or institution.

class.name: numerical_experiment
class.description: Defines a numerical experiment.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: related_experiments
attribute.description: A related experiment.

attribute.name: requirements
attribute.description: Requirements that conformant simulations need to satisfy.

class.name: multi_time_ensemble
class.description: Defines an experiment ensemble with multiple start dates.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: additional_requirements
attribute.description: Additional detail for this requirement.

attribute.name: conformance_is_requested
attribute.description: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

attribute.name: ensemble_members
attribute.description: Description of date or time set of start dates.

class.name: cimtext
class.description: Provides a text class which supports plaintext, html, and friends (or will do).

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Raw content (including markup).

attribute.name: content_type
attribute.description: Type of content.

class.name: composition
class.description: Describes how component variables are coupled together either to/from other SoftwareComponents or external data files. The variables specified by a component's composition must be owned by that component, or a child of that component; child components cannot couple together parent variables.

attribute.name: couplings
attribute.description: #FIXME.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: #FIXME.

class.name: component_performance
class.description: Describes the simulation rate of a component in seconds per model day.

attribute.name: component
attribute.description: Link to a CIM software component description.

attribute.name: cores_used
attribute.description: Number of cores used for this component.

attribute.name: nodes_used
attribute.description: Number of nodes used for this component.

attribute.name: speed
attribute.description: Time taken to simulate one real day (s).

attribute.name: component_name
attribute.description: Short name of component.

class.name: multi_ensemble
class.description: In the case of multiple ensemble axes, defines how they are set up and ordered.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: additional_requirements
attribute.description: Additional detail for this requirement.

attribute.name: conformance_is_requested
attribute.description: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

attribute.name: ensemble_axis
attribute.description: List of orthogonal ensembles.

class.name: detail
class.description: Provides detail of specific properties, there are two possible specialisations expected: (1) A detail_vocabulary is identified, and a cardinality is assigned to that for possible responses, or (2) Detail is used to provide a collection for a set of properties which are defined in the sub-class. However, those properties must have a type which is selected from the classmap (that is, standard 'non-es-doc' types).

attribute.name: context
attribute.description: Scientific context for which this description is provided.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of this process/algorithm/sub-process/detail.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Identifier for this collection of properties.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Free text description of process detail (if required).

attribute.name: select
attribute.description: Name of property to be selected from vocab.

attribute.name: with_cardinality
attribute.description: Required cardinality of selection from vocabulary.

choice.description: Zero or many selections are permitted
At least one, and possibly many, selections are required
Zero or one selections are permitted
One and only one selection is required

attribute.name: from_vocab
attribute.description: Name of an enumeration vocabulary of possible detail options.

attribute.name: detail_selection
attribute.description: List of choices from the vocabulary of possible detailed options.

class.name: development_path
class.description: Describes the software development path for this model/component.

attribute.name: developed_in_house
attribute.description: Model or component was mostly developed in house.

attribute.name: consortium_name
attribute.description: If model/component is developed as part of a consortium, provide consortium name.

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this software component.

attribute.name: previous_version
attribute.description: Name of a previous version.

attribute.name: creators
attribute.description: Those responsible for creating this component.

class.name: tuning
class.description: Method used to optimise equation parameters in model component (aka 'tuning').

attribute.name: regional_metrics_used
attribute.description: Which regional metrics of mean state (e.g Monsoons, tropical means etc) have been used in tuning.

attribute.name: trend_metrics_used
attribute.description: Which observed trend metrics have been used in tuning model parameters.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Brief description of tuning methodology. Include information about observational period(s) used.

attribute.name: global_mean_metrics_used
attribute.description: Set of metrics of the global mean state used in tuning model parameters.

class.name: date_time
class.description: A date or time. Either in simulation time with the simulation calendar, or with reference to a simulation start, in which case the datetime is an interval after the start date.

attribute.name: offset
attribute.description: Date is offset from start of an integration.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Date or time - some of (from left to right): yyyy-mm-dd:hh:mm:ss.

class.name: pid
class.description: A permanent identifier (with a resolution service).

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The identifier.

attribute.name: resolution_service
attribute.description: The resolution service.

class.name: temporal_constraint
class.description: A temporal constraint on a numerical experiment.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: additional_requirements
attribute.description: Additional detail for this requirement.

attribute.name: conformance_is_requested
attribute.description: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

attribute.name: required_calendar
attribute.description: Required calendar (e.g. for paleo simulations).

attribute.name: start_flexibility
attribute.description: Amount of time before required start date that it is permissible to begin integration.

attribute.name: start_date
attribute.description: Required start date.

attribute.name: required_duration
attribute.description: Constraint on time or length of simulation.

class.name: storage_pool
class.description: Homogeneous storage pool on a computing machine.

attribute.name: volume_available
attribute.description: Storage capacity.

attribute.name: vendor
attribute.description: Vendor of the storage unit.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of the technology used.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of storage.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of storage pool.

class.name: drs_atomic_dataset
class.description: An entity in a DRS file system.

attribute.name: frequency
attribute.description: Frequency of data stored in this entity.

choice.description: Sampling frequency less than an hour

attribute.name: version_number
attribute.description: Uniquely identifies a particular version of a publication level dataset.

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: A model identifier (sans blanks/periods and parenthesis).

attribute.name: institute
attribute.description: The institute responsible for this data entity.

attribute.name: activity
attribute.description: A model intercomparison activity or other project which aggregates or collects data.

attribute.name: realm
attribute.description: Modelling realm.

attribute.name: experiment
attribute.description: An experiment (or experiment family and type, e.g. rcp45).

attribute.name: product
attribute.description: Used to provide categories of data products within the activity.

attribute.name: geographical_constraint
attribute.description: Identifies geographical subsets and spatial means.

attribute.name: temporal_constraint
attribute.description: Identifies temporal subsets or means.

attribute.name: variable_name
attribute.description: Identifies the physical quantity (when used in conjunction with the MIP table).

attribute.name: ensemble_member
attribute.description: Unambiguously identifiers ensemble realisation information.

attribute.name: mip_table
attribute.description: The MIP table, together with the variable defines the physical quantity.

class.name: online_resource
class.description: A minimal approximation of ISO19115 CI_ONLINERESOURCE, provides a link and details of how to use that link.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Detail of how to access the resource.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of online resource.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: Protocol to use at the linkage.

attribute.name: linkage
attribute.description: A URL.

class.name: partition
class.description: A major partition (component) of a computing system (aka machine).

attribute.name: online_documentation
attribute.description: Links to documentation.

attribute.name: vendor
attribute.description: The system integrator or vendor.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Textural description of machine.

attribute.name: when_used
attribute.description: If no longer in use, the time period it was in use.

attribute.name: institution
attribute.description: Institutional location.

attribute.name: storage_pools
attribute.description: Storage resource available.

attribute.name: model_number
attribute.description: Vendor's model number/name - if it exists.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of partition (or machine).

attribute.name: compute_pools
attribute.description: Layout of compute nodes.

attribute.name: partition
attribute.description: If machine is partitioned, treat subpartitions as machines.

class.name: drs_geographical_indicator
class.description: Specifies geographical subsets described by bounding boxes or by named regions. One of spatial domain or bounding box must appear.

attribute.name: spatial_domain
attribute.description: Geographical indicator (currently only 'global' is acceptable).

attribute.name: bounding_box
attribute.description: DRS bounding box of the form 'latJHJJHHlonMZMMZZ' where H, HH, Z, ZZ are from {NS} {EW} respectively.

attribute.name: operator
attribute.description: Spatial averagin applied to the geographical region.

choice.description: Data is zonally averaged over land in region
Data is zonally averaged over oceans in region
Data is averaged over the area of the region
Data is averaged over the land area of the region
Data is averaged over the ocean area of the region

class.name: quality_review
class.description: Assertations as to the completeness and quality of a document.

attribute.name: quality_description
attribute.description: Assessment of quality of this document.

attribute.name: date
attribute.description: Date upon which review was made.

attribute.name: quality_status
attribute.description: Status from a controlled vocabulary.

choice.description: Author has completed document, prior to review
Document has been formally reviewed and assessed as complete and accurate

attribute.name: metadata_reviewer
attribute.description: Party who made the metadata quality assessment.

class.name: ensemble_axis
class.description: Defines the meaning of r/i/p indices in an ensemble.

attribute.name: target_requirement
attribute.description: URI of the target numerical requirement.

attribute.name: extra_detail
attribute.description: Any extra detail required to describe how this ensemble axis was delivered.

attribute.name: short_identifier
attribute.description: e.g. 'r' or 'i' or 'p' to conform with simulation ensemble variant identifiers.

attribute.name: member
attribute.description: Individual member descriptions along axis.

class.name: process
class.description: Provides structure for description of a process simulated within a particular area (or domain/realm/component) of a model. This will often be subclassed within a specific implementation so that constraints can be used to ensure that the process details requested are consistent with project requirements for information.

attribute.name: context
attribute.description: Scientific context for which this description is provided.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of this process/algorithm/sub-process/detail.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Identifier for this collection of properties.

attribute.name: sub_processes
attribute.description: Discrete portion of a process with common process details.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: keywords to help re-use and discovery of this information.

attribute.name: algorithms
attribute.description: Descriptions of algorithms and their properties used in the process.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: Sets of properties for this process.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Any relevant references describing this process and/or it's implementation.

attribute.name: implementation_overview
attribute.description: General overview description of the implementation of this process.

class.name: downscaling
class.description: Defines a downscaling activity.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: ran_for_experiments
attribute.description: One or more experiments with which the simulation is associated.

attribute.name: parent_simulation
attribute.description: If appropriate, detailed information about how this simulation branched from a previous one.

attribute.name: calendar
attribute.description: The calendar used in the simulation.

attribute.name: used
attribute.description: The model used to run the simulation.

attribute.name: part_of_project
attribute.description: Project or projects for which simulation was run.

attribute.name: primary_ensemble
attribute.description: Primary Ensemble (ensemble for which this simulation was first run).

attribute.name: ensemble_identifier
attribute.description: String that can be used to extract ensemble axis membership from the primary ensemble(e.g. cmip6 rip string as in the DRS).

attribute.name: downscaled_from
attribute.description: The simulation that was downscaled by this downscaling activity.

class.name: project
class.description: Describes a scientific project.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: previous_projects
attribute.description: Previous projects with similar aims.

attribute.name: sub_projects
attribute.description: Activities within the project with their own name and aim(s).

attribute.name: requires_experiments
attribute.description: Experiments required to deliver project.

class.name: regular_timeset
class.description: A regularly spaced set of times.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: Number of times in set.

attribute.name: increment
attribute.description: Interval between members of set.

attribute.name: start_date
attribute.description: Beginning of time set.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: Number of times in set.

class.name: doc_reference
class.description: Specialisation of online resource for link between CIM documents, whether the remote document exists when complete, or not.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Detail of how to access the resource.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of online resource.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: Protocol to use at the linkage.

attribute.name: linkage
attribute.description: A URL.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: Predicate - relationship of the object target as seen from the subject resource.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the remote record.

attribute.name: constraint_vocabulary
attribute.description: A constraint vocabulary for the relationship.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: The version of the remote record.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Identifier of remote resource, if known.

attribute.name: context
attribute.description: Information about remote record in context of reference.

class.name: numerical_requirement
class.description: A numerical requirement associated with a numerical experiment.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: additional_requirements
attribute.description: Additional detail for this requirement.

attribute.name: conformance_is_requested
attribute.description: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

class.name: algorithm
class.description: Used to hold information associated with an algorithm which implements some key part of a process. In most cases this is quite a high level concept and isn't intended to describe the gory detail of how the code implements the algorithm rather the key scientific aspects of the algorithm. In particular, it provides a method of grouping variables which take part in an algorithm within a process.

attribute.name: context
attribute.description: Scientific context for which this description is provided.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of this process/algorithm/sub-process/detail.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Identifier for this collection of properties.

attribute.name: implementation_overview
attribute.description: Overview of the algorithm implementation.

attribute.name: diagnostic_variables
attribute.description: Diagnostic variables associated with this algorithm.

attribute.name: prognostic_variables
attribute.description: Prognostic variables associated with this algorithm.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant references.

attribute.name: forced_variables
attribute.description: Variables held constant within algorithm.

class.name: storage_volume
class.description: Volume and units.

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: Volume units.

attribute.name: volume
attribute.description: Numeric value.

class.name: ensemble
class.description: Generic ensemble definition. Holds the definition of how the various ensemble members have been configured. If ensemble axes are not present, then this is either a single member ensemble, or part of an uber ensemble.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: has_ensemble_axes
attribute.description: Set of axes for the ensemble.

attribute.name: members
attribute.description: The set of ensemble members.

attribute.name: common_conformances
attribute.description: Conformance documents for requirements common across ensemble.

attribute.name: part_of
attribute.description: Link to one or more over-arching ensembles that might includes this one.

attribute.name: documentation
attribute.description: Links to web-pages and other ensemble specific documentation (including workflow descriptions).

attribute.name: supported
attribute.description: Experiments with which the ensemble is associated (may differ from constituent simulations).

class.name: entry_point
class.description: Describes a function or subroutine of a SoftwareComponent. BFG will use these EntryPoints to define a schedule of subroutine calls for a coupled model. Currently, a very basic schedule can be approximated by using the 'proceeds' and 'follows' attributes, however a more complete system is required for full BFG compatibility. Every EntryPoint can have a set of arguments associated with it. These reference (previously defined) variables.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: #FIXME.

class.name: drs_publication_dataset
class.description: A collection of atomic datasets which share a single combination of DRS component values.

attribute.name: frequency
attribute.description: Frequency of data stored in this entity.

choice.description: Sampling frequency less than an hour

attribute.name: version_number
attribute.description: Uniquely identifies a particular version of a publication level dataset.

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: A model identifier (sans blanks/periods and parenthesis).

attribute.name: institute
attribute.description: The institute responsible for this data entity.

attribute.name: activity
attribute.description: A model intercomparison activity or other project which aggregates or collects data.

attribute.name: realm
attribute.description: Modelling realm.

attribute.name: experiment
attribute.description: An experiment (or experiment family and type, e.g. rcp45).

attribute.name: product
attribute.description: Used to provide categories of data products within the activity.

class.name: drs_ensemble_identifier
class.description: Identifies an ensemble realisation.

attribute.name: realisation_number
attribute.description: Standard ensemble axis realisation number (usually an initial condition ensemble).

attribute.name: initialisation_method_number
attribute.description: Identifies which method of initialisation was used, if multiple methods used.

attribute.name: perturbation_number
attribute.description: Identifies different members of a perturbed physics ensemble.

class.name: variable_collection
class.description: A collection of variables within the scope of a code or process element.

attribute.name: collection_name
attribute.description: Name for this variable collection.

attribute.name: variables
attribute.description: Set of variable names.

class.name: key_properties
class.description: High level list of key properties. It can be specialised in extension packages using the detail extensions.

attribute.name: tuning_applied
attribute.description: Describe any tuning used to optimise the parameters in this domain.

attribute.name: grid
attribute.description: The grid used to layout the variables (e.g. the Global ENDGAME-grid).

attribute.name: extra_conservation_properties
attribute.description: Details of methodology needed to conserve variables between processes.

attribute.name: resolution
attribute.description: The resolution of the grid (e.g. N512L180).

attribute.name: time_step
attribute.description: Timestep (in seconds) of overall component.

attribute.name: additional_detail
attribute.description: Additional property details.

class.name: machine
class.description: A computer/system/platform/machine which is used for simulation.

attribute.name: online_documentation
attribute.description: Links to documentation.

attribute.name: vendor
attribute.description: The system integrator or vendor.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Textural description of machine.

attribute.name: when_used
attribute.description: If no longer in use, the time period it was in use.

attribute.name: institution
attribute.description: Institutional location.

attribute.name: storage_pools
attribute.description: Storage resource available.

attribute.name: model_number
attribute.description: Vendor's model number/name - if it exists.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of partition (or machine).

attribute.name: compute_pools
attribute.description: Layout of compute nodes.

attribute.name: partition
attribute.description: If machine is partitioned, treat subpartitions as machines.

class.name: variable
class.description: An instance of a model software variable which may be prognostic or diagnostic, and which is available as a connection to other software components. Note that these variables may only exist within the software workflow as interim quantities or coupling endpoints. Input and output variables will be a subset of these software variables.

attribute.name: prognostic
attribute.description: Whether or not prognostic or diagnostic.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of how the variable is being used in the s/w.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name for the variable.

class.name: key_float
class.description: Holds a key and a float value.

attribute.name: key
attribute.description: User defined key.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Value associated with a key (real number).

class.name: dataset
class.description: Dataset discovery information.

attribute.name: availability
attribute.description: Where the data is located, and how it is accessed.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of dataset.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: Individuals and organisations reponsible for the data.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Textural description of dataset.

attribute.name: produced_by
attribute.description: Makes a link back to originating activity.

attribute.name: drs_datasets
attribute.description: Data available in the DRS.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant reference document.

attribute.name: related_to_dataset
attribute.description: Related dataset.

class.name: ensemble_requirement
class.description: Defines an experiment ensemble.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: additional_requirements
attribute.description: Additional detail for this requirement.

attribute.name: conformance_is_requested
attribute.description: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

attribute.name: ensemble_type
attribute.description: Type of ensemble.

choice.description: Members differ in some aspects of their physics
Members differ in how they are initialised
Members are initialised to sample possible starting states
Members are initialised at different starting dates
Members are run at different resolutions

attribute.name: ensemble_member
attribute.description: Constraint on each ensemble member.

attribute.name: minimum_size
attribute.description: Minimum number of members.

class.name: performance
class.description: Describes the properties of a performance of a configured model on a particular system/machine.

attribute.name: subcomponent_performance
attribute.description: Describes the performance of each subcomponent.

attribute.name: coupler_load
attribute.description: Percentage of time spent in coupler.

attribute.name: platform
attribute.description: Platform on which performance was tested.

attribute.name: sypd
attribute.description: Simulated years per wall-clock day.

attribute.name: asypd
attribute.description: Actual simulated years per wall-clock day, all-in.

attribute.name: io_load
attribute.description: Percentage of time spent in I/O.

attribute.name: memory_bloat
attribute.description: Percentage of extra memory needed.

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: Model for which performance was tested.

attribute.name: load_imbalance
attribute.description: Load imbalance.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name for performance (experiment/test/whatever).

attribute.name: total_nodes_used
attribute.description: Number of nodes used.

attribute.name: compiler
attribute.description: Compiler used.

attribute.name: chsy
attribute.description: Core-Hours per simulated year.

class.name: software_component
class.description: An embedded piece of software that does not normally function as a standalone model (although it may be used standalone in a test harness).

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Long name for component.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Textural description of component.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name of component.

attribute.name: development_history
attribute.description: History of the development of this component.

attribute.name: release_date
attribute.description: The date of publication of the component code (as opposed to the date of publication of the metadata document, or the date of deployment of the model).

attribute.name: documentation
attribute.description: Descriptions of the component functionality.

attribute.name: repository
attribute.description: Location of code for this component.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version identifier.

attribute.name: coupling_framework
attribute.description: The coupling framework that this entire component conforms to.

choice.description: Customised coupler developed for this model
It is not known what/if-a coupler is used

attribute.name: license
attribute.description: The license held by this piece of software.

attribute.name: grid
attribute.description: A reference to the grid that is used by this component.

attribute.name: dependencies
attribute.description: #FIXME.

attribute.name: sub_components
attribute.description: Internal software sub-components of this component.

attribute.name: composition
attribute.description: #FIXME.

attribute.name: connection_points
attribute.description: The set of data entities which are available for I/O and/or coupling.

attribute.name: language
attribute.description: Language the component is written in.

class.name: calendar
class.description: Describes the calendar required/used in an experiment/simulation. This class is based on the calendar attributes and properties found in the CF netCDF conventions.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Can be used to name a special calendar type.

attribute.name: standard_name
attribute.description: Type of calendar used.

choice.description: Gregorian calendar with every year being a leap year, i.e., all years are 366 days long.
Synonym for gregorian: Mixed Gregorian/Julian calendar as defined by Udunits
Synonym for all_leap:Gregorian calendar with every year being a leap year, i.e., all years are 366 days long.
Mixed Gregorian/Julian calendar as defined by Udunits
All years are 360 days divided into 30 day months.
Gregorian calendar without leap years, i.e., all years are 365 days long.
Synonym for noleap:Gregorian calendar without leap years, i.e., all years are 365 days long.
A Gregorian calendar extended to dates before 1582-10-15. That is, a year is a leap year if either (i) it is divisible by 4 but not by 100 or (ii) it is divisible by 400.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Extra information about the calendar.

attribute.name: month_lengths
attribute.description: Used for special calendars to provide month lengths.

class.name: simulation_plan
class.description: Describes a simulation that needs to be run.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: will_support_experiments
attribute.description: An experiment with which the planned simulation will be associated.

attribute.name: expected_platform
attribute.description: The machine on which the simulation will be run.

attribute.name: expected_model
attribute.description: The model used to run the simulation.

attribute.name: expected_performance_sypd
attribute.description: Expected performance in simulated years per real day.

class.name: parent_simulation
class.description: Defines the relationship between a simulation and its parent.

attribute.name: branch_time_in_child
attribute.description: The time at which the present simulation started in the child calendar.

attribute.name: parent
attribute.description: The parent simulation of this child.

attribute.name: branch_time_in_parent
attribute.description: The time in parent simulation calendar at which this simulation was branched.

class.name: drs_temporal_identifier
class.description: Provides information about temporal subsetting and/or averaging. If only N1 is present, it a temporal instant, If N1-N2 are present with no suffix, it is a temporal subset, If N1-N2 with a suffix are present, then some sort of temporal averaging has been applied across the period.

attribute.name: suffix
attribute.description: If present, used to indicate climatology or average.

choice.description: Indicates data is climatological average data at the DRS frequency from the period N1-N2
Indicates data is a single average of DRS frequency data across temporal period N1-N2

attribute.name: end
attribute.description: N2, required to indicate a period.

attribute.name: start
attribute.description: N1, of the form yyyy[MM[dd[hh[mm[ss]]]]].

class.name: ensemble_member
class.description: An ensemble may be a complicated interplay of axes, for example, r/i/p, not all of which are populated, so we need a list of the actual simulations and how they map onto the ensemble axes.

attribute.name: errata
attribute.description: Link to errata associated with this simulation.

attribute.name: simulation
attribute.description: Actual simulation description for an ensemble member.

attribute.name: variant_id
attribute.description: A string which concatenates axis member short identiers (e.g r1i1p1f1).

attribute.name: had_performance
attribute.description: Performance of the simulation.

attribute.name: ran_on
attribute.description: The machine on which the simulation was run.

class.name: responsibility
class.description: Implements the ISO19115-1 (2014) CI_Responsibility (which replaces responsibleParty). Combines a person and their role in doing something.

attribute.name: party
attribute.description: Parties delivering responsibility.

attribute.name: when
attribute.description: Period when role was active, if no longer.

attribute.name: role
attribute.description: Role that the party plays or played.

choice.description: Contributor to the production of the resource
Party that accepts accountability and responsibility for the source resource
Party who carried out an independent review of (this) documentation
Party who has invested in the production of the resource
Party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource
Key party responsible for the existence of the resource
Party with legal ownership of the resource
Original source for the resource if obtained from elsewhere
Party who has taken part in the workflow that resulted in this resource

class.name: time_period
class.description: A time period class aka a temporal extent.

attribute.name: date_type
attribute.description: Describes how the date is used to define the period.

choice.description: The date defines the start of the period
The date is the end of the period

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: Duration of the time period.

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: Appropriate time units.

attribute.name: calendar
attribute.description: Calendar, default is standard aka gregorian.

attribute.name: date
attribute.description: Optional start/end date of time period.

class.name: conformance
class.description: A specific conformance. Describes how a particular numerical requirement has been implemented. Will normally be linked from an ensemble descriptor.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: target_requirement
attribute.description: URI of the target numerical requirement.

class.name: extent
class.description: Key scientific characteristics of the grid use to simulate a specific domain. Note that the extent does not itself describe a grid, so, for example, a polar stereographic grid may have an extent of northern boundary 90N, southern boundary 45N, but the fact that it is PS comes from the grid_type.

attribute.name: top_vertical_level
attribute.description: Top vertical level centre (e.g. level at TOA or level near ocean surface).

attribute.name: z_units
attribute.description: Units of vertical measure (e.g. m, Pa, sigma_level.

attribute.name: northern_boundary
attribute.description: If not global, northern boundary in degrees of latitude.

attribute.name: bottom_vertical_level
attribute.description: Bottom vertical level centre (e.g. level near land surface or level ocean floor).

attribute.name: region_known_as
attribute.description: Identifier or identifiers for the region covered by the extent.

attribute.name: eastern_boundary
attribute.description: If not global, eastern boundary in degrees of longitude.

attribute.name: western_boundary
attribute.description: If not global, western boundary in degrees of longitude.

attribute.name: southern_boundary
attribute.description: If not global, southern boundary in degrees of latitude.

attribute.name: is_global
attribute.description: True if horizontal coverage is global.

class.name: uber_ensemble
class.description: An ensemble made up of other ensembles. Often used where parts of an ensemble were run by different institutes. Could also be used when a new experiment is designed which can use ensemble members from previous experiments and/or projects.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: has_ensemble_axes
attribute.description: Set of axes for the ensemble.

attribute.name: members
attribute.description: The set of ensemble members.

attribute.name: common_conformances
attribute.description: Conformance documents for requirements common across ensemble.

attribute.name: part_of
attribute.description: Link to one or more over-arching ensembles that might includes this one.

attribute.name: documentation
attribute.description: Links to web-pages and other ensemble specific documentation (including workflow descriptions).

attribute.name: supported
attribute.description: Experiments with which the ensemble is associated (may differ from constituent simulations).

attribute.name: child_ensembles
attribute.description: Ensemble which are aggregated into this one.

class.name: reference
class.description: An external document which can have a context associated with it.

attribute.name: context
attribute.description: Brief text description of why this resource is being cited.

attribute.name: document
attribute.description: Reference Target.

class.name: compute_pool
class.description: Homogeneous pool of nodes within a computing machine.

attribute.name: model_number
attribute.description: Model/Board number/type.

attribute.name: accelerator_type
attribute.description: Type of accelerator.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of compute pool within a machine.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Textural description of pool.

attribute.name: interconnect
attribute.description: Interconnect used.

attribute.name: memory_per_node
attribute.description: Memory per node.

attribute.name: compute_cores_per_node
attribute.description: Number of CPU cores per node.

attribute.name: number_of_nodes
attribute.description: Number of nodes.

attribute.name: accelerators_per_node
attribute.description: Number of accelerator units on a node.

attribute.name: operating_system
attribute.description: Operating system.

attribute.name: cpu_type
attribute.description: CPU type.

class.name: axis_member
class.description: Description of a given ensemble member. It will normally be related to a specific ensemble requirement. Note that start dates can be extracted directly from the simulations and do not need to be recorded with an axis member description.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: If parameter varied, value thereof for this member.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: The ensemble member index.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of the member (or name of parameter varied).

attribute.name: extra_detail
attribute.description: If necessary: further information about ensemble member conformance.

class.name: simulation
class.description: Simulation class provides the integrating link about what models were run and wny. In many cases this should be auto-generated from output file headers.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: ran_for_experiments
attribute.description: One or more experiments with which the simulation is associated.

attribute.name: parent_simulation
attribute.description: If appropriate, detailed information about how this simulation branched from a previous one.

attribute.name: calendar
attribute.description: The calendar used in the simulation.

attribute.name: used
attribute.description: The model used to run the simulation.

attribute.name: part_of_project
attribute.description: Project or projects for which simulation was run.

attribute.name: primary_ensemble
attribute.description: Primary Ensemble (ensemble for which this simulation was first run).

attribute.name: ensemble_identifier
attribute.description: String that can be used to extract ensemble axis membership from the primary ensemble(e.g. cmip6 rip string as in the DRS).

class.name: gridspec
class.description: Fully defines the computational grid used.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Textural description.

class.name: output_temporal_requirement
class.description: Provides details of when output is required from an experiment. Typically output will be required in one of three modes: (1) continuous, (2) continuous for a set of subset periods, or (3) sliced for a set of months in a year or days in a month.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Short name or abbreviation.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Relevant documentation.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Longer version of activity name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

attribute.name: rationale
attribute.description: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: People or organisations responsible for activity.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: User defined keywords.

attribute.name: canonical_name
attribute.description: Community defined identifier or name.

attribute.name: additional_requirements
attribute.description: Additional detail for this requirement.

attribute.name: conformance_is_requested
attribute.description: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

attribute.name: throughout
attribute.description: Whether or not output is required throughout simulation.

attribute.name: continuous_subset
attribute.description: Set of periods for which continuous output is required.

attribute.name: sliced_subset
attribute.description: Description of how slices are laid out.

class.name: timeslice_list
class.description: A list of referential dates, e.g. yearlist, 1,4,5 would refer to jan,april,may, monthlist, 1,5,6 would refer to the 1st, 5th and 6th of the month.

attribute.name: members
attribute.description: Values as integers.

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: Interval against which members refer.
